attributes.mlflow.spanInputs:
{"system_prompt": "You are Roadcast's documentation concierge. Blend GitBook product docs with runtime RAG snippets to provide crisp, actionable answers for internal operators. Every reply must be factual, cite numbered references, and clearly separate summaries from implementation steps.", "user_question": "types of billings in bolt", "snippets": ["[1] Title: Bolt V2 Fleet Management: End-User | Documentation | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
Bolt V2 Fleet Management: End-User
Real-time fleet intelligence and configurable workflows that keep product owners and consumers moving in sync.
What it is
: Bolt is a unified operations intelligence platform for organizations that manage fleets, field assets, and on-ground personnel. It merges real-time visibility, configurable workflows, and deep reporting into a single web experience.
Who it’s for
:
Product Owners: orchestrate programs, configure roles, and align KPIs.
Portal Operators: run daily operations—devices, trips, notifications, incidents, yard logistics.
Pu", "[2] Title: Administration & Governance | Documentation | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/administration-and-governance
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
Basic Docs
Administration & Governance
hashtag
RBAC & Permission Guardrails
The platform enforces strict
Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
.
URL Protection:
If a Client User manually types an Admin-only URL (like
/admin/device-models
), the system returns a
403 Forbidden
error and logs the attempt.
Inheritance:
Custom roles can be created at the Parent level and pushed down to all Child Branches.
hashtag
Impersonation & Audit Trails
To assist with support and debugging, Admins have the ability to "Impersonate" users.
Security Protocol:
An Admin cannot change a client's pa", "[3] Title: UI/UX Specifications & Design System | Documentation | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/ui-ux-specifications-and-design-system
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
Basic Docs
UI/UX Specifications & Design System
This section outlines the visual standards, interaction logic, and user experience principles that define the Bolt V2 platform.
hashtag
Unified Design Language
Bolt V2 uses a utility-first design system built on
Tailwind CSS
. The goal is to provide a clean, high-performance interface that prioritizes data visibility.
Management Hub Approach:
The interface is split into two distinct modes:
Admin Side (Roadcast):
Designed for high-density data management, bulk configurations, and global oversight.
Client Side:
Designed for o", "[4] Title: Home | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
house
Home
Start here. Learn the product fast, find the right workflows, and get back to ops.
hashtag
Welcome to the BOLT V2 docs
You’re in the right place if you run fleets, field assets, or on‑ground teams.
This space helps you go from “what is BOLT?” to “ship it in production”.
circle-info

If you’re integrating systems, start with the overview.
hashtag

I’m running ops today
→ find workflows, exceptions, and day‑to‑day actions."], "format_instructions": "If a query cannot be answered from the provided snippets, say so explicitly and recommend which doc to read.
Use the format: ## Direct Answer, ## Key Details (bullets), ## References (numbered list).
Always mention the reference number in-line like [1] whenever referencing a fact.
Keep answers under 220 words unless the user asks for exhaustive detail.
Highlight commands or API names with backticks.
Never hallucinate URLs; always reuse the snippet URLs provided.
Follow the template strictly:
## Direct Answer
<2-3 sentence summary>
## Key Details
- Bullet fact with inline [number]
- Another fact
## References
[List every reference as [n] Title — URL]
Keep the overall response under 150 words unless the user explicitly asks for a detailed or long explanation."}
attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
{"answer_markdown": "## Direct Answer
The provided snippets do not explicitly describe the types of billings in Bolt. To find detailed information about billing types, it is recommended to consult the Bolt V2 Fleet Management or Administration & Governance sections of the Roadcast documentation.

## Key Details
- Bolt is a unified operations intelligence platform for fleet and field asset management [1].
- The platform includes administration and governance features such as RBAC and permission guardrails but does not mention billing types [2].
- For billing specifics, reviewing the full documentation or contacting support may be necessary.

## References
[1] Bolt V2 Fleet Management: End-User — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation  
[2] Administration & Governance — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/administration-and-governance"}

attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
[{"role": "system", "content": "Your input fields are:
1. `system_prompt` (str): Agent system prompt describing persona and guardrails
2. `user_question` (str): End-user query to answer
3. `snippets` (list[str]): List of numbered passages generated from GitBook search results
4. `format_instructions` (str): Explicit formatting instructions, including headings and reference block template
Your output fields are:
1. `answer_markdown` (str): Well-structured markdown answer that cites references in-text and ends with a references list
All interactions will be structured in the following way, with the appropriate values filled in.

[[ ## system_prompt ## ]]
{system_prompt}

[[ ## user_question ## ]]
{user_question}

[[ ## snippets ## ]]
{snippets}

[[ ## format_instructions ## ]]
{format_instructions}

[[ ## answer_markdown ## ]]
{answer_markdown}

[[ ## completed ## ]]
In adhering to this structure, your objective is: 
        Formats GitBook search snippets into a markdown answer with references."}, {"role": "user", "content": "[[ ## system_prompt ## ]]

Learn the product fast, find the right workflows, and get back to ops.\nhashtag\nWelcome to the BOLT V2 docs\nYou’re in the right place if you run fleets, field assets, or on‑ground teams.\nThis space helps you go from “what is BOLT?” to “ship it in production”.\ncircle-info\nThese docs are written for operators and product owners first.\nIf you’re integrating systems, start with the overview.\nhashtag\nPick your path\nI’m new here\n→ get the big picture, then learn the core concepts.\nI’m running ops today\n→ find workflows, exceptions, and day‑to‑day actions."]

[[ ## format_instructions ## ]]

attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
["[[ ## answer_markdown ## ]]
## Direct Answer
The provided snippets do not explicitly describe the types of billings in Bolt. To find detailed information about billing types, it is recommended to consult the Bolt V2 Fleet Management or Administration & Governance sections of the Roadcast documentation.

## Key Details
- Bolt is a unified operations intelligence platform for fleet and field asset management [1].
- The platform includes administration and governance features such as RBAC and permission guardrails but does not mention billing types [2].
- For billing specifics, reviewing the full documentation or contacting support may be necessary.

## References
[1] Bolt V2 Fleet Management: End-User — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation  
[2] Administration & Governance — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/administration-and-governance  

[[ ## completed ## ]]"]
